   23: -module(ssh_protocol_SUITE).
   24: 
   25: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   26: -include_lib("kernel/include/inet.hrl").
   27: -include("ssh.hrl").		% ?UINT32, ?BYTE, #ssh{} ...
   28: -include("ssh_transport.hrl").
   29: -include("ssh_auth.hrl").
   30: -include("ssh_test_lib.hrl").
   31: 
   32: -export([
   33:          suite/0,
   34:          all/0,
   35:          groups/0,
   36:          init_per_suite/1,
   37:          end_per_suite/1,
   38:          init_per_testcase/2,
   39:          end_per_testcase/2
   40:         ]).
   41: 
   42: -export([
   43:          bad_long_service_name/1,
   44:          bad_packet_length/2,
   45:          bad_service_name/1,
   46:          bad_service_name/2,
   47:          bad_service_name_length/2,
   48:          bad_service_name_then_correct/1,
   49:          bad_very_long_service_name/1,
   50:          client_handles_keyboard_interactive_0_pwds/1,
   51:          client_info_line/1,
   52:          do_gex_client_init/3,
   53:          do_gex_client_init_old/3,
   54:          empty_service_name/1,
   55:          ext_info_c/1,
   56:          ext_info_s/1,
   57:          kex_strict_negotiated/1,
   58:          kex_strict_msg_ignore/1,
   59:          kex_strict_msg_unknown/1,
   60:          gex_client_init_option_groups/1,
   61:          gex_client_init_option_groups_file/1,
   62:          gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file/1,
   63:          gex_client_old_request_exact/1,
   64:          gex_client_old_request_noexact/1,
   65:          gex_server_gex_limit/1,
   66:          lib_match/1,
   67:          lib_no_match/1,
   68:          lib_works_as_client/1,
   69:          lib_works_as_server/1,
   70:          modify_append/1,
   71:          modify_combo/1,
   72:          modify_prepend/1,
   73:          modify_rm/1,
   74:          no_common_alg_client_disconnects/1,
   75:          no_common_alg_server_disconnects/1,
   76:          no_ext_info_s1/1,
   77:          no_ext_info_s2/1,
   78:          packet_length_too_large/1,
   79:          packet_length_too_short/1,
   80:          preferred_algorithms/1,
   81:          service_name_length_too_large/1,
   82:          service_name_length_too_short/1,
   83:          client_close_after_hello/1
   84:         ]).
   85: 
   86: -define(NEWLINE, <<"\r\n">>).
   87: -define(REKEY_DATA_TMO, 65000).
   88: 
   89: -define(DEFAULT_KEX, 'diffie-hellman-group14-sha256').
   90: -define(EXTRA_KEX, 'diffie-hellman-group1-sha1').
   91: 
   92: -define(CIPHERS, ['aes256-ctr','aes192-ctr','aes128-ctr','aes128-cbc','3des-cbc']).
   93: -define(DEFAULT_CIPHERS, (fun() -> Ciphs = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
   94:                                    [{client2server,Ciphs}, {server2client,Ciphs}]
   95:                           end)()
   96:         ).
   97: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   98: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
   99: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  100: suite() ->
  101:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
  102:      {timetrap,{seconds,40}}].
  103: 
  104: all() -> 
  105:     [{group,tool_tests},
  106:      client_info_line,
  107:      {group,kex},
  108:      {group,service_requests},
  109:      {group,authentication},
  110:      {group,packet_size_error},
  111:      {group,field_size_error},
  112:      {group,ext_info},
  113:      {group,preferred_algorithms},
  114:      {group,client_close_early}
  115:     ].
  116: 
  117: groups() ->
  118:     [{tool_tests, [], [lib_works_as_client,
  119: 		       lib_works_as_server,
  120: 		       lib_match,
  121: 		       lib_no_match
  122: 		      ]},
  123:      {packet_size_error, [], [packet_length_too_large,
  124: 			      packet_length_too_short]},
  125:       
  126:      {field_size_error, [], [service_name_length_too_large,
  127: 			     service_name_length_too_short]},
  128:       
  129:      {kex, [], [no_common_alg_server_disconnects,
  130: 		no_common_alg_client_disconnects,
  131: 		gex_client_init_option_groups,
  132: 		gex_server_gex_limit,
  133: 		gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file,
  134: 		gex_client_init_option_groups_file,
  135: 		gex_client_old_request_exact,
  136: 		gex_client_old_request_noexact,
  137:                 kex_strict_negotiated,
  138:                 kex_strict_msg_ignore,
  139:                 kex_strict_msg_unknown]},
  140:      {service_requests, [], [bad_service_name,
  141: 			     bad_long_service_name,
  142: 			     bad_very_long_service_name,
  143: 			     empty_service_name,
  144: 			     bad_service_name_then_correct
  145: 			    ]},
  146:      {authentication, [], [client_handles_keyboard_interactive_0_pwds
  147: 			  ]},
  148:      {ext_info, [], [no_ext_info_s1,
  149:                      no_ext_info_s2,
  150:                      ext_info_s,
  151:                      ext_info_c
  152:                     ]},
  153:      {preferred_algorithms, [], [preferred_algorithms,
  154:                                  modify_append,
  155:                                  modify_prepend,
  156:                                  modify_rm,
  157:                                  modify_combo
  158:                                 ]},
  159:      {client_close_early, [], [client_close_after_hello
  160:                                ]}
  161:     ].
  162: 
  163: 
  164: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  165:     ?CHECK_CRYPTO(start_std_daemon( setup_dirs( start_apps(Config)))).
  166: 
  167: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  168:     stop_apps(Config).
  169: 
  170: init_per_testcase(no_common_alg_server_disconnects, Config) ->
  171:     start_std_daemon(Config, [{preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-rsa']},
  172:                                                      {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  173:                                                     ]}]);
  174: init_per_testcase(kex_strict_negotiated, Config) ->
  175:     Config;
  176: init_per_testcase(TC, Config) when TC == gex_client_init_option_groups ;
  177: 				   TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file ;
  178: 				   TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_file ;
  179: 				   TC == gex_server_gex_limit ;
  180: 				   TC == gex_client_old_request_exact ;
  181: 				   TC == gex_client_old_request_noexact ->
  182:     Opts = case TC of
  183: 	       gex_client_init_option_groups ->
  184: 		   [{dh_gex_groups, 
  185:                      [{1023, 5, 
  186:                        16#D9277DAA27DB131C03B108D41A76B4DA8ACEECCCAE73D2E48CEDAAA70B09EF9F04FB020DCF36C51B8E485B26FABE0337E24232BE4F4E693548310244937433FB1A5758195DC73B84ADEF8237472C46747D79DC0A2CF8A57CE8DBD8F466A20F8551E7B1B824B2E4987A8816D9BC0741C2798F3EBAD3ADEBCC78FCE6A770E2EC9F
  187:                       }]}];
  188: 	       gex_client_init_option_groups_file ->
  189: 		   DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  190: 		   F = filename:join(DataDir, "dh_group_test"),
  191: 		   [{dh_gex_groups, {file,F}}];
  192: 	       gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file ->
  193: 		   DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  194: 		   F = filename:join(DataDir, "dh_group_test.moduli"),
  195: 		   [{dh_gex_groups, {ssh_moduli_file,F}}];
  196: 	       _ when TC == gex_server_gex_limit ;
  197: 		      TC == gex_client_old_request_exact ;
  198: 		      TC == gex_client_old_request_noexact ->
  199: 		    [{dh_gex_groups, 
  200:                       [{1023, 2, 16#D9277DAA27DB131C03B108D41A76B4DA8ACEECCCAE73D2E48CEDAAA70B09EF9F04FB020DCF36C51B8E485B26FABE0337E24232BE4F4E693548310244937433FB1A5758195DC73B84ADEF8237472C46747D79DC0A2CF8A57CE8DBD8F466A20F8551E7B1B824B2E4987A8816D9BC0741C2798F3EBAD3ADEBCC78FCE6A771225323},
  201:                        {1535, 5, 16#D1391174233D315398FE2830AC6B2B66BCCD01B0A634899F339B7879F1DB85712E9DC4E4B1C6C8355570C1D2DCB53493DF18175A9C53D1128B592B4C72D97136F5542FEB981CBFE8012FDD30361F288A42BD5EBB08BAB0A5640E1AC48763B2ABD1945FEE36B2D55E1D50A1C86CED9DD141C4E7BE2D32D9B562A0F8E2E927020E91F58B57EB9ACDDA106A59302D7E92AD5F6E851A45FA1CFE86029A0F727F65A8F475F33572E2FDAB6073F0C21B8B54C3823DB2EF068927E5D747498F96E1E827},
  202:                        {3071, 2, 16#DFAA35D35531E0F524F0099877A482D2AC8D589F374394A262A8E81A8A4FB2F65FADBAB395E05D147B29D486DFAA41F41597A256DA82A8B6F76401AED53D0253F956CEC610D417E42E3B287F7938FC24D8821B40BFA218A956EB7401BED6C96C68C7FD64F8170A8A76B953DD2F05420118F6B144D8FE48060A2BCB85056B478EDEF96DBC70427053ECD2958C074169E9550DD877779A3CF17C5AC850598C7586BEEA9DCFE9DD2A5FB62DF5F33EA7BC00CDA31B9D2DD721F979EA85B6E63F0C4E30BDDCD3A335522F9004C4ED50B15DC537F55324DD4FA119FB3F101467C6D7E1699DE4B3E3C478A8679B8EB3FA5C9B826B44530FD3BE9AD3063B240B0C853EBDDBD68DD940332D98F148D5D9E1DC977D60A0D23D0CA1198637FEAE4E7FAAC173AF2B84313A666CFB4EE6972811921D0AD867CE57F3BBC8D6CB057E3B66757BB46C9F72662624D44E14528327E3A7100E81A12C43C4E236118318CD90C8AA185BBB0C764826DAEAEE8DD245C5B451B4944E6122CC522D1C335C2EEF9429825A2B}
  203:                       ]},
  204:                      {dh_gex_limits, {1023,2000}}
  205: 		    ];
  206: 	       _ ->
  207: 		   []
  208: 	   end,
  209:     start_std_daemon(Config,
  210: 		     [{preferred_algorithms,[{cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  211:                                             ]}
  212: 		      | Opts]);
  213: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  214:     check_std_daemon_works(Config, ?LINE).
  215: 
  216: end_per_testcase(no_common_alg_server_disconnects, Config) ->
  217:     stop_std_daemon(Config);
  218: end_per_testcase(kex_strict_negotiated, Config) ->
  219:     Config;
  220: end_per_testcase(TC, Config) when TC == gex_client_init_option_groups ;
  221: 				  TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file ;
  222: 				  TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_file ;
  223: 				  TC == gex_server_gex_limit ;
  224: 				  TC == gex_client_old_request_exact ;
  225: 				  TC == gex_client_old_request_noexact ->
  226:     stop_std_daemon(Config);
  227: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  228:     check_std_daemon_works(Config, ?LINE).
  229: 
  230: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  231: %%% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  232: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  233: 
  234: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  235: %%% Connect to an erlang server and check that the testlib acts as a client.
  236: lib_works_as_client(Config) ->
  237:     %% Connect and negotiate keys
  238:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  239: 			  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]}]
  240: 			 ),
  241:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex(Config, InitialState),
  242: 
  243:     %% Do the authentcation
  244:     {User,Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
  245:     {ok,EndState} =
  246: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  247: 	  [{send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-userauth"}},
  248: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name = "ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
  249: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{user = User,
  250: 					    service = "ssh-connection",
  251: 					    method = "password",
  252: 					    data = <<?BOOLEAN(?FALSE),
  253: 						     ?STRING(unicode:characters_to_binary(Pwd))>>
  254: 					   }},
  255: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{_='_'}, receive_msg}
  256: 	  ], AfterKexState),
  257: 
  258:     %% Disconnect
  259:     {ok,_} =
  260: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  261: 	  [{send, #ssh_msg_disconnect{code = ?SSH_DISCONNECT_BY_APPLICATION,
  262: 				      description = "End of the fun",
  263: 				      language = ""
  264: 				     }},
  265: 	   close_socket
  266: 	  ], EndState).
  267: 
  268: 
  269: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  270: %%% Connect an erlang client and check that the testlib can act as a server.
  271: lib_works_as_server(Config) ->
  272:     {User,_Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
  273: 
  274:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  275:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  276:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  277: 
  278:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  279:     spawn_link(
  280:       fun() ->
  281: 	      {ok,_} =
  282: 		  ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  283: 		    [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
  284: 		     {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  285: 			       {user_dir, user_dir(Config)}]},
  286: 		     receive_hello,
  287: 		     {send, hello},
  288: 
  289: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  290: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  291: 
  292: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_init{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  293: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_reply},
  294: 
  295: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
  296: 		     {match,  #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  297: 
  298: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
  299: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  300: 
  301: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  302: 						       method="none",
  303: 						       user=User,
  304: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  305: 
  306: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_failure{authentications = "password",
  307: 						      partial_success = false}},
  308: 
  309: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  310: 						       method="password",
  311: 						       user=User,
  312: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  313: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{}},
  314: 		     close_socket,
  315: 		     print_state
  316: 		    ],
  317: 		    InitialState)
  318:       end),
  319: 
  320:     %% and finally connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client:
  321:     {ok,_} = std_connect(HostPort, Config, 
  322: 			 [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  323:                                                  {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  324:                                                 ]}
  325:                          ]
  326: 			).
  327: 
  328: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  329: %%% Matching
  330: lib_match(_Config) ->
  331:     {ok,_} =
  332: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec([{set_options, [print_ops]},
  333: 				{match, abc, abc},
  334: 				{match, '$a', {cde,fgh}},
  335: 				{match, {cde,fgh}, '$a'},
  336: 				{match, '_', {cde,fgh}},
  337: 				{match, [a,'$a',b], [a,{cde,fgh},b]},
  338: 				{match, [a,'$a'|'$b'], [a,{cde,fgh},b,c]},
  339: 				{match, '$b', [b,c]}
  340: 			       ]).
  341: 
  342: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  343: %%% Not matching
  344: lib_no_match(_Config) ->
  345:     case ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec([{set_options, [print_ops]},
  346: 				 {match, '$x', b},
  347: 				 {match, a, '$x'}])
  348:     of
  349: 	{ok,_} -> {fail,"Unexpected match"};
  350: 	{error, {_Op,{expected,a,b},_State}} -> ok
  351:     end.
  352: 
  353: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  354: %%% Algo negotiation fail.  This should result in a ssh_msg_disconnect
  355: %%% being sent from the server.
  356: no_common_alg_server_disconnects(Config) ->
  357:     {ok,_} =
  358: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  359: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, {print_messages,detail}]},
  360: 	   {connect,
  361: 	    ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config),ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
  362: 	    [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  363: 	     {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  364: 	     {user_interaction, false},
  365: 	     {preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-dss']},
  366:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  367:                                    ]}
  368: 	    ]},
  369: 	   receive_hello,
  370: 	   {send, hello},
  371: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  372: 	   {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},  % with server unsupported 'ssh-dss' !
  373: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  374: 	  ]
  375: 	 ).
  376: 
  377: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  378: %%% Algo negotiation fail.  This should result in a ssh_msg_disconnect
  379: %%% being sent from the client.
  380: no_common_alg_client_disconnects(Config) ->
  381:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  382:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  383:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  384:     Parent = self(),
  385: 
  386:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  387:     Pid =
  388: 	spawn_link(
  389: 	  fun() ->
  390: 		  Parent !
  391: 		      {result,self(),
  392: 		       ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  393: 			 [{set_options, [print_ops, {print_messages,detail}]},
  394: 			  {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  395: 				    {user_dir, user_dir(Config)}]},
  396: 			  receive_hello,
  397: 			  {send, hello},
  398: 			  {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  399: 			  {send,  #ssh_msg_kexinit{ % with unsupported "SOME-UNSUPPORTED"
  400: 				     cookie = <<80,158,95,51,174,35,73,130,246,141,200,49,180,190,82,234>>,
  401: 				     kex_algorithms = [atom_to_list(?DEFAULT_KEX)],
  402: 				     server_host_key_algorithms = ["SOME-UNSUPPORTED"],  % SIC!
  403: 				     encryption_algorithms_client_to_server = ["aes128-ctr"],
  404: 				     encryption_algorithms_server_to_client = ["aes128-ctr"],
  405: 				     mac_algorithms_client_to_server = ["hmac-sha2-256"],
  406: 				     mac_algorithms_server_to_client = ["hmac-sha2-256"],
  407: 				     compression_algorithms_client_to_server = ["none"],
  408: 				     compression_algorithms_server_to_client = ["none"],
  409: 				     languages_client_to_server = [],
  410: 				     languages_server_to_client = [],
  411: 				     first_kex_packet_follows = false,
  412: 				     reserved = 0
  413: 				    }},
  414: 			  {match, disconnect(?SSH_DISCONNECT_KEY_EXCHANGE_FAILED), receive_msg}
  415: 			 ],
  416: 			 InitialState)
  417: 		      }
  418: 	  end),
  419: 
  420:     %% and finally connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client
  421:     %% which of course does not support SOME-UNSUPPORTED as pub key algo:
  422:     Result = std_connect(HostPort, Config, [{preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-dss']},
  423:                                                                    {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  424:                                                                   ]}]),
  425:     ct:log("Result of connect is ~p",[Result]),
  426: 
  427:     receive
  428: 	{result,Pid,{ok,_}} -> 
  429: 	    ok;
  430: 	{result,Pid,{error,{Op,ExecResult,S}}} ->
  431: 	    ct:log("ERROR!~nOp = ~p~nExecResult = ~p~nState =~n~s",
  432: 		   [Op,ExecResult,ssh_trpt_test_lib:format_msg(S)]),
  433: 	    {fail, ExecResult};
  434: 	X -> 
  435: 	    ct:log("¤¤¤¤¤"),
  436: 	    ct:fail(X)
  437:     after 
  438: 	30000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  439:     end.
  440: 
  441: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  442: gex_client_init_option_groups(Config) ->
  443:     do_gex_client_init(Config, {512, 2048, 4000},

  464: do_gex_client_init(Config, {Min,N,Max}, {G,P}) ->
  465:     {ok,_} =
  466: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  467: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  468: 	   {connect,
  469: 	    ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config),ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
  470: 	    [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  471: 	     {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  472: 	     {user_interaction, false},
  473: 	     {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,['diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256']},
  474:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  475:                                    ]}
  476: 	    ]},
  477: 	   receive_hello,
  478: 	   {send, hello},
  479: 	   {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  480: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  481: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_kex_dh_gex_request{min = Min, 
  482: 					      n = N,
  483: 					      max = Max}},
  484: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_kex_dh_gex_group{p=P, g=G, _='_'},  receive_msg}
  485: 	  ]
  486: 	 ).
  487:

  492:                            ).

  497:                            ).

  508: 	     {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,['diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256']},
  509:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  510:                                    ]}
  511: 	    ]},
  512: 	   receive_hello,

  521: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  522: bad_service_name(Config) -> 
  523:     bad_service_name(Config, "kfglkjf").
  524:     
  525: bad_long_service_name(Config) -> 
  526:     bad_service_name(Config, 
  527: 		     lists:duplicate(?SSH_MAX_PACKET_SIZE div 2, $a)).
  528: 
  529: bad_very_long_service_name(Config) -> 
  530:     bad_service_name(Config,
  531: 		     lists:duplicate(?SSH_MAX_PACKET_SIZE+5, $a)).
  532: 
  533: empty_service_name(Config) ->
  534:     bad_service_name(Config, "").
  535:     
  536: bad_service_name_then_correct(Config) ->
  537:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  538:     {ok,_} =
  539: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  540: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  541: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "kdjglkfdjgkldfjglkdfjglkfdjglkj"}},
  542: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-connection"}},
  543: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  544: 	   ], InitialState).
  545: 
  546: 
  547: bad_service_name(Config, Name) ->
  548:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  549:     {ok,_} =
  550: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  551: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  552: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = Name}},
  553: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  554: 	  ], InitialState).
  555: 
  556: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  557: packet_length_too_large(Config) -> bad_packet_length(Config, +4).
  558: 
  559: packet_length_too_short(Config) -> bad_packet_length(Config, -4).
  560:     
  561: bad_packet_length(Config, LengthExcess) ->
  562:     PacketFun = 
  563: 	fun(Msg, Ssh) ->
  564: 		BinMsg = ssh_message:encode(Msg),
  565: 		ssh_transport:pack(BinMsg, Ssh, LengthExcess)
  566: 	end,
  567:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  568:     {ok,_} =
  569: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  570: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  571: 	   {send, {special,
  572: 		   #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"},
  573: 		   PacketFun}},
  574: 	   %% Prohibit remote decoder starvation:	   
  575: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  576: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  577: 	  ], InitialState).
  578: 
  579: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  580: service_name_length_too_large(Config) -> bad_service_name_length(Config, +4).
  581: 
  582: service_name_length_too_short(Config) -> bad_service_name_length(Config, -4).
  583: 
  584: 
  585: bad_service_name_length(Config, LengthExcess) ->
  586:     PacketFun = 
  587: 	fun(#ssh_msg_service_request{name=Service}, Ssh) ->
  588: 		BinName = list_to_binary(Service),
  589: 		BinMsg = 
  590: 		    <<?BYTE(?SSH_MSG_SERVICE_REQUEST),
  591: 		      %% A bad string encoding of Service:
  592: 		      ?UINT32(size(BinName)+LengthExcess), BinName/binary
  593: 		    >>,
  594: 		ssh_transport:pack(BinMsg, Ssh)
  595: 	end,
  596:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  597:     {ok,_} =
  598: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  599: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  600: 	   {send, {special,
  601: 		   #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}, 
  602: 		   PacketFun} },
  603: 	   %% Prohibit remote decoder starvation:	   
  604: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  605: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  606: 	  ], InitialState).
  607:     
  608: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  609: %%% This is due to a fault report (OTP-13255) with OpenSSH-6.6.1
  610: client_handles_keyboard_interactive_0_pwds(Config) ->
  611:     {User,_Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
  612: 
  613:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  614:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  615:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  616: 
  617:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  618:     spawn_link(
  619:       fun() ->
  620: 	      {ok,_} =
  621: 		  ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  622: 		    [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
  623: 		     {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  624: 			       {user_dir, user_dir(Config)}]},
  625: 		     receive_hello,
  626: 		     {send, hello},
  627: 
  628: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  629: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  630: 
  631: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_init{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  632: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_reply},
  633: 
  634: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
  635: 		     {match,  #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  636: 
  637: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
  638: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  639: 
  640: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  641: 						       method="none",
  642: 						       user=User,
  643: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  644: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_failure{authentications = "keyboard-interactive",
  645: 						      partial_success = false}},
  646: 		     
  647: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  648: 						       method="keyboard-interactive",
  649: 						       user=User,
  650: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  651: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_request{name = "",
  652: 							   instruction = "",
  653: 							   language_tag = "",
  654: 							   num_prompts = 1,
  655: 							   data = <<0,0,0,10,80,97,115,115,119,111,114,100,58,32,0>>
  656: 							  }},
  657: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_response{num_responses = 1,
  658: 							     _='_'}, receive_msg},
  659: 		      
  660: 		     %% the next is strange, but openssh 6.6.1 does this and this is what this testcase is about
  661: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_request{name = "",
  662: 							   instruction = "",
  663: 							   language_tag = "",
  664: 							   num_prompts = 0,
  665: 							   data = <<>>
  666: 							  }},
  667: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_response{num_responses = 0,
  668: 							     data = <<>>,
  669: 							     _='_'}, receive_msg},
  670: 		     %% Here we know that the tested fault is fixed
  671: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{}},
  672: 		     close_socket,
  673: 		     print_state
  674: 		    ],
  675: 		    InitialState)
  676:       end),
  677: 
  678:     %% and finally connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client:
  679:     {ok,_} = std_connect(HostPort, Config, 
  680: 			 [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  681:                                                  {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  682:                                                 ]}]
  683: 			).
  684: 
  685: 
  686: 
  687: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  688: client_info_line(Config) ->
  689:     %% A client must not send an info-line. If it does, the server should handle
  690:     %% handle this gracefully
  691:     {ok,Pid} = ssh_eqc_event_handler:add_report_handler(),
  692:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  693:     {_, _, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir,DataDir}]),
  694: 
  695:     %% Fake client:
  696:     {ok,S} = gen_tcp:connect("localhost",Port,[]),
  697:     gen_tcp:send(S,"An illegal info-string\r\n"),
  698:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  699: 
  700:     %% wait for server to react:
  701:     timer:sleep(1000),
  702: 
  703:     %% check if a badmatch was received:
  704:     {ok, Reports} = ssh_eqc_event_handler:get_reports(Pid),
  705:     case lists:any(fun({error_report,_,{_,supervisor_report,L}}) when is_list(L) -> 
  706: 			   lists:member({reason,{badmatch,{error,closed}}}, L);
  707: 		      (_) ->
  708: 			   false
  709: 		   end, Reports) of
  710: 	true ->
  711: 	    ct:fail("Bad error report on info_line from client");
  712: 	false ->
  713: 	    ok
  714:     end.
  715: 	
  716: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  717: %%% The server does not send the extension because
  718: %%% the client does not tell the server to send it
  719: no_ext_info_s1(Config) ->
  720:     %% Start the daemon
  721:     Server = {Pid,_,_} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{send_ext_info,true},
  722:                                               {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}]),
  723:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex([{server,Server}|Config]),
  724:     {ok,_} = 
  725:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  726:           [{send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-userauth"}},
  727: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name = "ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg}
  728:           ], AfterKexState),
  729:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  730: 
  731: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  732: %%% The server does not send the extension because
  733: %%% the server is not configured to send it
  734: no_ext_info_s2(Config) ->    
  735:     %% Start the daemon
  736:     Server = {Pid,_,_} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{send_ext_info,false},
  737:                                               {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}]),
  738:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex([{extra_options,[{recv_ext_info,true}]},
  739:                                           {server,Server}
  740:                                           | Config]),
  741:     {ok,_} =
  742:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  743:           [{send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-userauth"}},
  744: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name = "ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg}
  745:           ], AfterKexState),
  746:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  747: 
  748: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  749: %%% The server sends the extension
  750: ext_info_s(Config) ->    
  751:     %% Start the daemon
  752:     Server = {Pid,_,_} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{send_ext_info,true},
  753:                                               {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}]),
  754:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex([{extra_options,[{recv_ext_info,true}]},
  755:                                           {server,Server}
  756:                                           | Config]),
  757:     {ok,_} =
  758:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  759:           [{match, #ssh_msg_ext_info{_='_'}, receive_msg}
  760:           ],
  761:           AfterKexState),
  762:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  763: 
  764: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  765: %%% The client sends the extension
  766: ext_info_c(Config) ->    
  767:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  768:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  769:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  770: 
  771:     Parent = self(),
  772:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  773:     Pid =
  774:         spawn_link(
  775:           fun() ->
  776:                   Result =
  777:                       ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  778:                         [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
  779:                          {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  780:                                    {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  781:                                    {recv_ext_info, true}
  782:                                   ]},
  783:                          receive_hello,
  784:                          {send, hello},
  785:                          
  786:                          {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  787:                          {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  788:                          
  789:                          {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_init{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  790:                          {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_reply},
  791: 
  792:                          {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
  793:                          {match,  #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  794: 
  795:                          {match, #ssh_msg_ext_info{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  796: 
  797:                          close_socket,
  798:                          print_state
  799:                         ],
  800:                         InitialState),
  801:                   Parent ! {result,self(),Result}
  802:           end),
  803: 
  804:     %% connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client
  805:     %% (expect error due to the close_socket in daemon):
  806:     {error,_} = std_connect(HostPort, Config, 
  807:                             [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  808:                                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  809:                                                    ]},
  810:                              {tstflg, [{ext_info_client,true}]},
  811:                              {send_ext_info, true}
  812:                             ]
  813:                            ),
  814:     
  815:     %% Check that the daemon got expected result:
  816:     receive
  817:         {result, Pid, {ok,_}} -> ok;
  818:         {result, Pid, Error} -> ct:fail("Error: ~p",[Error])
  819:     end.
  820: 
  821: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  822: %%%
  823: kex_strict_negotiated(Config0) ->
  824:     {ok, TestRef} = ssh_test_lib:add_log_handler(),
  825:     Config = start_std_daemon(Config0, []),
  826:     {Server, Host, Port} = proplists:get_value(server, Config),
  827:     Level = ssh_test_lib:get_log_level(),
  828:     ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(debug),
  829:     {ok, ConnRef} = std_connect({Host, Port}, Config, []),
  830:     {algorithms, _A} = ssh:connection_info(ConnRef, algorithms),
  831:     ssh:stop_daemon(Server),
  832:     {ok, Events} = ssh_test_lib:get_log_events(TestRef),
  833:     true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(client, Events),
  834:     true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(server, Events),
  835:     ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(Level),
  836:     ssh_test_lib:rm_log_handler(),
  837:     ok.
  838: 
  839: %% Connect to an erlang server and inject unexpected SSH ignore
  840: kex_strict_msg_ignore(Config) ->
  841:     ct:log("START: ~p~n=================================", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  842:     ExpectedReason = "strict KEX violation: unexpected SSH_MSG_IGNORE",
  843:     TestMessages =
  844:         [{send, ssh_msg_ignore},
  845:          {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_reply{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  846:          {match, disconnect(?SSH_DISCONNECT_KEY_EXCHANGE_FAILED), receive_msg}],
  847:     kex_strict_helper(Config, TestMessages, ExpectedReason).
  848: 
  849: %% Connect to an erlang server and inject unexpected non-SSH binary
  850: kex_strict_msg_unknown(Config) ->
  851:     ct:log("START: ~p~n=================================", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  852:     ExpectedReason = "Bad packet: Size",
  853:     TestMessages =
  854:         [{send, ssh_msg_unknown},
  855:          {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_reply{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  856:          {match, disconnect(?SSH_DISCONNECT_KEY_EXCHANGE_FAILED), receive_msg}],
  857:     kex_strict_helper(Config, TestMessages, ExpectedReason).
  858: 
  859: kex_strict_helper(Config, TestMessages, ExpectedReason) ->
  860:     {ok, TestRef} = ssh_test_lib:add_log_handler(),
  861:     Level = ssh_test_lib:get_log_level(),
  862:     ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(debug),
  863:     %% Connect and negotiate keys
  864:     {ok, InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  865: 			  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]}]
  866: 			 ),
  867:     {ok, _AfterKexState} =
  868:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  869:           [{connect,
  870:             ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config),ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
  871:             [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  872:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  873:                                    ]},
  874:              {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  875:              {recv_ext_info, false},
  876:              {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  877:              {user_interaction, false}
  878:             | proplists:get_value(extra_options,Config,[])
  879:             ]},
  880:            receive_hello,
  881:            {send, hello},
  882:            {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  883:            {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  884:            {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_init}] ++
  885:               TestMessages,
  886:           InitialState),
  887:     ct:sleep(100),
  888:     {ok, Events} = ssh_test_lib:get_log_events(TestRef),
  889:     ssh_test_lib:rm_log_handler(),
  890:     ct:log("Events = ~p", [Events]),
  891:     true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(client, Events),
  892:     true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(server, Events),
  893:     true = ssh_test_lib:event_logged(server, Events, ExpectedReason),
  894:     ssh_test_lib:set_log_level(Level),
  895:     ok.
  896: 
  897: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  898: %%%
  899: preferred_algorithms(Config) ->
  900:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
  901:     {error,{eoptions,{{preferred_algorithms,{kex,[some_unknown_algo]}},
  902:                       "Unsupported value(s) found"}}} =
  903:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
  904:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX],
  905:                       Ciphers,
  906:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  907:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
  908:                                               ]}
  909:                       ]).
  910: 
  911: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  912: %%%
  913: modify_append(Config) ->
  914:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
  915:     {ok,_} =
  916:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
  917:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX, ?EXTRA_KEX, list_to_atom(?kex_strict_s)],
  918:                       Ciphers,
  919:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  920:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
  921:                                               ]},
  922:                        {modify_algorithms, [{append,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]}]}]}
  923:                       ]).
  924: 
  925: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  926: %%%
  927: modify_prepend(Config) ->
  928:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
  929:     {ok,_} =
  930:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
  931:                       [?EXTRA_KEX, ?DEFAULT_KEX, list_to_atom(?kex_strict_s)],
  932:                       Ciphers,
  933:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  934:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
  935:                                               ]},
  936:                        {modify_algorithms, [{prepend,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]}]}]}
  937:                       ]).
  938: 
  939: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  940: %%%
  941: modify_rm(Config) ->
  942:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
  943:     {ok,_} =
  944:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
  945:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX, list_to_atom(?kex_strict_s)],
  946:                       tl(Ciphers),
  947:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX,?EXTRA_KEX]},
  948:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
  949:                                               ]},
  950:                        {modify_algorithms, [{rm,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]},
  951:                                                  {cipher,[hd(Ciphers)]}
  952:                                                 ]}
  953:                                            ]}
  954:                       ]).
  955: 
  956: 
  957: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  958: %%%
  959: modify_combo(Config) ->
  960:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
  961:     LastC = lists:last(Ciphers),
  962:     {ok,_} =
  963:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
  964:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX, list_to_atom(?kex_strict_s)],
  965:                       [LastC] ++ (tl(Ciphers)--[LastC]) ++ [hd(Ciphers)],
  966:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX,?EXTRA_KEX]},
  967:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
  968:                                               ]},
  969:                        {modify_algorithms, [{rm,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]}
  970:                                                 ]},
  971:                                             {prepend,[{cipher,[{server2client,[LastC]}]}
  972:                                                      ]},
  973:                                             {append,[{cipher,[a,hd(Ciphers),b]}
  974:                                                     ]}
  975:                                            ]}
  976:                       ]).
  977: 
  978: 
  979: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  980: %%%
  981: client_close_after_hello(Config0) ->
  982:     MaxSessions = 20,
  983:     SleepSec = 15,
  984:     Config = start_std_daemon(Config0, [{parallel_login,true},
  985:                                         {max_sessions,MaxSessions},
  986:                                         {negotiation_timeout,SleepSec*1000}
  987:                                        ]),
  988:     {_Parents0, Conns0, []} =
  989:         ssh_test_lib:find_handshake_parent(ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config)),
  990:     Cs =
  991:         [ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  992:            [{connect,
  993:              ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config),ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
  994:              [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  995:                                      {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  996:                                     ]},
  997:               {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  998:               {recv_ext_info, false},
  999:               {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1000:               {user_interaction, false}
 1001:               | proplists:get_value(extra_options,Config,[])
 1002:              ]},
 1003:             {send, hello}
 1004:            ]) || _ <- lists:seq(1,MaxSessions+100)],
 1005:     ct:log("=== Tried to start ~p sessions.", [length(Cs)]),
 1006:     ssh_info:print(fun ct:log/2),
 1007:     {Parents, Conns, Handshakers} =
 1008:         ssh_test_lib:find_handshake_parent(ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config)),
 1009:     ct:log("Found (Port=~p):~n"
 1010:            "  Connections  (length ~p): ~p~n"
 1011:            "  Handshakers  (length ~p): ~p~n"
 1012:            "  with parents (length ~p): ~p",
 1013:            [ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
 1014:             length(Conns), Conns,
 1015:             length(Handshakers), Handshakers,
 1016:             length(Parents), Parents]),
 1017:     if
 1018:         length(Handshakers)>0 ->
 1019:             lists:foreach(fun(P) -> exit(P,some_reason) end, Parents),
 1020:             ct:log("After sending exits; now going to sleep", []),
 1021:             timer:sleep((SleepSec+15)*1000),
 1022:             ct:log("After sleeping", []),
 1023:             ssh_info:print(fun ct:log/2),
 1024:             {Parents2, Conns2, Handshakers2} =
 1025:                 ssh_test_lib:find_handshake_parent(ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config)),
 1026:             ct:log("Found (Port=~p):~n"
 1027:                    "  Connections  (length ~p): ~p~n"
 1028:                    "  Handshakers  (length ~p): ~p~n"
 1029:                    "  with parents (length ~p): ~p",
 1030:                    [ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
 1031:                     length(Conns2), Conns2,
 1032:                     length(Handshakers2), Handshakers2,
 1033:                     length(Parents2), Parents2]),
 1034:             if
 1035:                 Handshakers2==[] andalso Conns2==Conns0 ->
 1036:                     ok;
 1037:                 Handshakers2=/=[] ->
 1038:                     ct:log("Handshakers still alive: ~p", [Handshakers2]),
 1039:                     {fail, handshakers_alive};
 1040:                 true ->
 1041:                     ct:log("Connections before: ~p~n"
 1042:                            "Connections after: ~p", [Conns0,Conns2]),
 1043:                     {fail, connections_bad}
 1044:             end;
 1045: 
 1046:         true ->
 1047:             {fail, no_handshakers}
 1048:     end.
 1049: 
 1050: 
 1051: %%%================================================================
 1052: %%%==== Internal functions ========================================
 1053: %%%================================================================
 1054: 
 1055: chk_pref_algs(Config,
 1056:               ExpectedKex,
 1057:               ExpectedCiphers,
 1058:               ServerPrefOpts) ->
 1059:     %% Start the daemon
 1060:     case ssh_test_lib:daemon(
 1061:                       [{send_ext_info,false},
 1062:                        {recv_ext_info,false},
 1063:                        {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}
 1064:                        | ServerPrefOpts])
 1065:     of
 1066:         {_,Host,Port} ->
 1067:             %% Check the Kex part
 1068:             ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
 1069:               [{set_options, [print_ops, {print_messages,detail}]},
 1070:                {connect, Host, Port,
 1071:                 [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1072:                  {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1073:                  {user_interaction, false}
 1074:                 ]},
 1075:                {send, hello},
 1076:                receive_hello,
 1077:                {match,
 1078:                 #ssh_msg_kexinit{
 1079:                    kex_algorithms = to_lists(ExpectedKex),
 1080:                    encryption_algorithms_server_to_client = to_lists(ExpectedCiphers),
 1081:                    _   = '_'},
 1082:                 receive_msg}
 1083:               ]);
 1084:         Error ->
 1085:             Error
 1086:     end.
 1087: 
 1088: 
 1089: filter_supported(K, Algs) -> Algs -- (Algs--supported(K)).
 1090: 
 1091: supported(_K) -> proplists:get_value(
 1092:                    server2client,
 1093:                    ssh_transport:supported_algorithms(cipher)).
 1094: 
 1095: to_lists(L) -> lists:map(fun erlang:atom_to_list/1, L).
 1096:     
 1097: 
 1098: %%%---- init_suite and end_suite ---------------------------------------	
 1099: start_apps(Config) ->
 1100:     catch ssh:stop(),
 1101:     ok = ssh:start(),
 1102:     Config.
 1103: 
 1104: stop_apps(_Config) ->
 1105:     ssh:stop().
 1106: 
 1107: 
 1108: setup_dirs(Config) ->
 1109:     ct:log("Pub keys setup for: ~p",
 1110:            [ssh_test_lib:setup_all_user_host_keys(Config)]),
 1111:     Config.
 1112: 
 1113: system_dir(Config) -> filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), system).
 1114: 
 1115: user_dir(Config) -> proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config).
 1116: 
 1117: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1118: start_std_daemon(Config) ->	
 1119:     start_std_daemon(Config, []).
 1120: 
 1121: start_std_daemon(Config, ExtraOpts) ->
 1122:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), 
 1123:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1124:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1125:     UserPasswords = [{"user1","pwd1"}],
 1126:     Options = [%%{preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-rsa']}]}, %% For some test cases
 1127: 	       {system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
 1128: 	       {user_dir, UserDir},
 1129: 	       {user_passwords, UserPasswords},
 1130: 	       {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}
 1131: 	       | ExtraOpts],
 1132:     Ref = {Server, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon(Options),
 1133:     ct:log("Std server ~p started at ~p:~p~nOptions=~p",[Server, Host, Port, Options]),
 1134:     [{server,Ref}, {user_passwords, UserPasswords} | Config].
 1135: 
 1136: 
 1137: stop_std_daemon(Config) ->
 1138:     ssh:stop_daemon(ssh_test_lib:server_pid(Config)),
 1139:     ct:log("Std server ~p at ~p:~p stopped",
 1140:            [ssh_test_lib:server_pid(Config), ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config),
 1141:             ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config)]),
 1142:     lists:keydelete(server, 1, Config).
 1143: 
 1144: 
 1145: check_std_daemon_works(Config, Line) ->
 1146:     case std_connect(Config) of
 1147: 	{ok,C} ->
 1148: 	    ct:log("Server ~p:~p ~p is ok at line ~p",
 1149: 		   [ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config), ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
 1150: 		    ssh_test_lib:server_pid(Config), Line]),
 1151: 	    ok = ssh:close(C),
 1152: 	    Config;
 1153: 	Error = {error,_} ->
 1154: 	    ct:fail("Standard server ~p:~p ~p is ill at line ~p: ~p",
 1155: 		    [ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config), ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
 1156: 		     ssh_test_lib:server_pid(Config), Line, Error])
 1157:     end.
 1158: 
 1159: server_user_password(Config) -> server_user_password(1, Config).
 1160: 
 1161: server_user_password(N, Config) -> lists:nth(N, ?v(user_passwords,Config)).
 1162: 
 1163: std_connect(Config) ->
 1164:     std_connect({ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config),
 1165:                  ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config)}, Config).
 1166: 
 1167: std_connect({Host,Port}, Config) ->
 1168:     std_connect({Host,Port}, Config, []).
 1169: 
 1170: std_connect({Host,Port}, Config, Opts) ->
 1171:     std_connect(Host, Port, Config, Opts).
 1172: 
 1173: std_connect(Host, Port, Config, Opts) ->
 1174:     {User,Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
 1175:     ssh:connect(Host, Port, 
 1176: 		%% Prefer User's Opts to the default opts
 1177: 		[O || O = {Tag,_} <- [{user,User},{password,Pwd},
 1178: 				      {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1179:                                       {save_accepted_host, false},
 1180: 				      {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1181: 				      {user_interaction, false}],
 1182: 		      not lists:keymember(Tag, 1, Opts)
 1183: 		] ++ Opts,
 1184: 		30000).
 1185:     
 1186: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------	
 1187: connect_and_kex(Config) ->
 1188:     connect_and_kex(Config, ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec([]) ).
 1189: 
 1190: connect_and_kex(Config, InitialState) ->
 1191:     ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
 1192:       [{connect,
 1193: 	ssh_test_lib:server_host(Config),ssh_test_lib:server_port(Config),
 1194: 	[{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
 1195:                                 {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
 1196:                                ]},
 1197:          {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1198:          {recv_ext_info, false},
 1199: 	 {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1200: 	 {user_interaction, false}
 1201:          | proplists:get_value(extra_options,Config,[])
 1202:         ]},
 1203:        receive_hello,
 1204:        {send, hello},
 1205:        {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
 1206:        {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
 1207:        {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_init},
 1208:        {match,# ssh_msg_kexdh_reply{_='_'}, receive_msg},
 1209:        {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
 1210:        {match, #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg}
 1211:       ],
 1212:       InitialState).
 1213: 
 1214: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1215: 
 1216: %%% For matching peer disconnection
 1217: disconnect() ->
 1218:     disconnect('_').
 1219: 
 1220: disconnect(Code) ->
 1221:     {'or',[#ssh_msg_disconnect{code = Code,
 1222: 			       _='_'},
 1223: 	   tcp_closed,
 1224: 	   {tcp_error,econnaborted}
 1225: 	  ]}.
